This is yet another attack on law-abiding gun owners by the Biden administration. Even the Obama administration approved the use of pistol stabilizing braces & recognized that these were still pistols--not short-barreled rifles.  
I strongly oppose this rule & will fight it (6/6)

Perhaps most concerningly, the Biden administration is also requiring all pistol brace owners to submit a picture of their firearm as part of the registration and "amnesty" process. This picture will be included in the ATF's public gun registry and database. (5/6)

Last year, the ATF processed approximately 500,000 NFA registration forms. At that rate, it would take the ATF between 20 and 80 years to process all the new required registrations. The ATF does not have any plan to deal with this impending backlog. (4/6)

Next, under the NFA, short-barreled rifle registration is subject to a $200 tax. This means that these law-abiding gun owners will now be subject to a surprise tax, which could total upwards of $20-80 billion! This is a huge burden on the average owner of a pistol brace. (3/6)

First, according to the Congressional Research Service, approximately 10-40 million pistol braces are privately owned. To be clear, this is not a minor rule-making tweak. This is a massive change, without Congressional approval, that will impact millions of gun owners. (2/6)
